templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml:
Lanes is total number of cross-section lanes, including high-occupancy, general purpose, collector-distributor, and arterial/collector lanes.
Functional Type is the FT value as defined in the travel demand model.
Capacity per Hour per Lane is the number of vehicles that can be served by her per lane. This includes reductions due to capacity factors and signals on arterials/collectors.
Free-flow Speed is the uncongested maximum speed in miles-per-hour.
Volume this is the total number of vehicles that are served during the time interval.
Speed is the congested travel speed for a given link.
Max V/C Ratio is the worst volume-over-capacity ratio by direction by time interval.

compare_abs.name: Change in Capacity per Hour per Lane

compare_pct.name: Percent Change in Capacity per Hour per Lane

main.name: Max Volume-to-Capacity Ratio
main.valueExpression: var v  = $feature.dVal; if (v==0  ) { return 'nodata'  ; } else if (v< 0.7) { return 'class_00'; } else if (v< 0.8) { return 'class_01'; } else if (v< 0.9) { return 'class_02'; } else if (v< 1.0) { return 'class_03'; } else if (v< 1.1) { return 'class_r0'; } else if (v< 1.2) { return 'class_r1'; } else if (v< 1.3) { return 'class_r2'; } else if (v< 1.4) { return 'class_r3'; } else if (v< 1.5) { return 'class_r4'; } else if (v< 1.6) { return 'class_r5'; } else if (v< 1.7) { return 'class_r6'; } else if (v< 1.8) { return 'class_r7'; } else if (v< 1.9) { return 'class_r8'; } else if (v< 2.0) { return 'class_r9'; } else if (v>=2.0) { return 'class_b0'; }

compare_abs.name: Change in Volume-to-Capacity Ratio
compare_abs.valueExpression: var v  = $feature.dVal; if (v<=-1.00) { return 'class_1'; } else if (v< -0.50) { return 'class_2'; } else if (v< -0.15) { return 'class_3'; } else if (v< -0.05) { return 'class_4'; } else if (v<  0.05) { return 'class_5'; } else if (v<  0.15) { return 'class_6'; } else if (v<  0.50) { return 'class_7'; } else if (v<  1.00) { return 'class_8'; } else { return 'class_9'; }

templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml:
Vehicle-Miles Traveled is the total miles traveled by all vehicles in a specified area over a given period of time.
Vehicle-Hours Traveled measures the total time spent by all vehicles traveling within a specified area over a given period of time.
Lane-Miles is the total length of lanes on roadways calculated by multiplying the length of a road segment by the number of lanes in that segment.

templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml: Riders is the total number of people on traveling on transit for a given segment across all routes that use that segment.

PA Boardings refers to the count of passengers boarding (getting on) public transportation in a specific direction, which is from the point of production (e.g. home) to the point of attraction (e.g. work).
PA Alightings is refers to the count of passengers alighting (getting off) public transportation in a specific direction, which is from the point of production (e.g. home) to the point of attraction (e.g. work).

This directionality emphasizes the movement of individuals from places where they live (production areas) to places where they seek employment, services, entertainment, shopping, or other activities (attraction areas).

templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml:
All Trips represents the total number of trips taken from (Production) or to (Attriction) using all modes of transportation.
Motorized Trips includes all trips made using motorized means of transportation, such as cars, motorcycles, and public transit vehicles.
Auto Trips specifically refers to trips made using personal automobiles, highlighting private vehicle use.
Transit Trips is the number of trips made using public transportation services, including buses and trains.
Non-Motorized Trips encompasses trips made without the use of motorized vehicles, primarily focusing on walking and bicycling.
Walk Trips specifically the number of trips made entirely on foot.
Bike Trips refers to trips made using bicycles.

templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml:
Population represents the total number of individuals living within an area.
Households is the total number of occupied residential units.
Total Vehicles is the cumulative count of vehicles owned or available for use by households.
Total Workers is the number of individuals within the population who are employed and part of the workforce.
Employment - 3 Categories is the distribution of employment across three broad categories.
Employment - 12 Categories is a more detailed division of employment statistics in twelve distinct categories.
Average Income is the mean income level of individuals or households within the area.
K-12 School Enrollment is the total number of students enrolled in K-12 educational institutions within the specified area.

compare_pct.name: Percent Change in K-12 School Enrollment

templateSettings.attributeInfoTextHtml:
Access to Jobs is the average number of jobs that are reachable to a resident within a set travel time.
Access to Households is the average number of households that are reachable to a business within a set travel time.
Access to Jobs+Households is the weighted combination of Access to Jobs and Access to Households.
Job Locations shows where jobs are located.
Household Locations shows where households are located.
